generif.text: a 3.7-kilobase lncRNA, terminal differentiation-induced ncRNA (TINCR), controls human epidermal differentiation by a post-transcriptional mechanism
TINCR, together with Staufen1, seems to stabilize a subset of mRNAs required for epidermal differentiation.
It is a functional molecule which plays essential roles by forming complexes with each other to maintain life. Long ncRNA and small ncRNA play a role as a ligand with sequence information.
findings suggest that TINCR contributes to the oncogenic potential of GC and may constitute a potential therapeutic target in this disease.
Study suggests that TINCR promotes proliferation, migration and invasion of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) cells, acting as a potential oncogene of ESCC.
These findings elucidate that loss of TINCR expression promotes proliferation and metastasis in colorectal cancer and it could be considered as a potential cancer suppressor gene.
long non-coding RNA TINCR polymorphisms may be implicated in GC development.
Our results firstly indicate that SNP rs2288947 and rs8105637 may act as independent biomarkers associated with occurrence and progression of CRC.

These results provide the first evidence that the expression of TINCR in HCC may play an oncogenic role in HCC differentiation, invasion, and metastasis. miR-137/miR-133a-TINCR pathway may serve as a promising target for tumor recurrence and prognosis of patients with HCC.
our findings demonstrated that TINCR could attenuate myocardial hypertrophy by epigenetically silencing of CaMKII, which may provide a novel therapeutic strategy for cardiac hypertrophy.
E2F1 induces TINCR transcriptional activity and accelerates gastric cancer progression via activation of TINCR/STAU1/CDKN2B signaling axis.
Low TINCR expression is associated with pituitary null cell adenomas.
TINCR suppressed proliferation and invasion through regulating miR-544a/FBXW7 axis in lung cancer.
TINCR upregulation may signal through the MAPK pathway to promote NSCLC tumorigenesis
in this study we characterized TINCR overexpression regulated by SP1 transcription factor. High level of TINCR consequently contributed to the oncogenic activity of TINCR.
lncRNA TINCR is downregulated in diabetic cardiomyopathy and it can inhibit cardiomyocyte apoptosis.

a regulatory function of the lncRNA TINCR/miR-107/CD36 axis in colorectal cancer was revealed; lncRNA TINCR overexpression exerted suppressive influence on CRC progression through modulating the PPAR signaling pathway via the miR-107/CD36 axis

significantly upregulated in burn-injured skin tissues in vivo and heat-stimulated dermal fibroblasts in vitro, accompanied by an increase in TGF-beta1 expression. Direct binding to SND! was verified.  Silencing TINCR reduced expression of TGF-beta1, cell proliferation, colony formation and inflammation in heat-stressed fibroblasts.

Results indicated that lncRNA PLAC2 is transcriptionally activated by H3K27ac modification at the promoter region in oral squamous cell carcinoma, and promotes cell growth and metastasis via activating Wnt/betacatenin signaling pathway.
lncRNA TINCR participates in ALA-PDT-induced apoptosis and autophagy in cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma.
The rs2288947 A > G polymorphism of the lncRNA TINCR may not be associated with recurrent miscarriage in a Southern Chinese population.
TINCR sponges miR-302 to upregulate cyclin D1 in CSCC, thereby promoting cell proliferation.
lncRNA PLAC2 down-regulated miR-21 in non-small cell lung cancer and inhibited cancer cell migration and invasion.
these findings suggest that TINCR knockdown inhibits TCF4 by regulating miR-137 expression in colorectal cancer cells
Knockdown of terminal differentiation induced ncRNA (TINCR) suppresses proliferation and invasion in hepatocellular carcinoma by targeting the miR-218-5p/DEAD-box helicase 5 (DDX5) axis.
TINCR is not a non-coding RNA but encodes a protein component of cornified epidermal keratinocytes.
Deregulation of long noncoding RNAs ANCR, TINCR, HOTTIP and SPRY4-IT1 in plasma of systemic sclerosis patients: SPRY4-IT1 as a novel biomarker of scleroderma and its subtypes.
Overexpression of lncRNA TINCR is associated with high-grade, invasive, and recurring tumors, and facilitates proliferation in vitro and in vivo of urothelial carcinoma of the bladder.
miR5893p sponged by the lncRNA TINCR inhibits the proliferation, migration and invasion and promotes the apoptosis of breast cancer cells by suppressing the Akt pathway via IGF1R.
Circ_0000376 enhances the proliferation, metastasis, and chemoresistance of NSCLC cells via repressing miR-384.
lncRNA TINCR facilities bladder cancer progression via regulating miR7 and mTOR.
Long Noncoding RNA TINCR-Mediated Regulation of Acetyl-CoA Metabolism Promotes Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma Progression and Chemoresistance.
Serum lncRNA TINCR Serve as a Novel Biomarker for Predicting the Prognosis in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer.
Long non-coding RNA PLAC2 suppresses the survival of gastric cancer cells through down-regulating C-Myc.
lncRNA TINCR SNPs and Expression Levels Are Associated with Bladder Cancer Susceptibility.
LncRNA TINCR favors tumorigenesis via STAT3-TINCR-EGFR-feedback loop by recruiting DNMT1 and acting as a competing endogenous RNA in human breast cancer.
Long noncoding RNA TINCR is a novel regulator of human bronchial epithelial cell differentiation state.
Noncanonical immune response to the inhibition of DNA methylation by Staufen1 via stabilization of endogenous retrovirus RNAs.
Long non-coding RNA TINCR promotes hepatocellular carcinoma proliferation and invasion via STAT3 signaling by direct interacting with T-cell protein tyrosine phosphatase (TCPTP).
Expression of lncRNA TINCR in the placenta of patients with pre-eclampsia and its effect on the biological behaviours of trophoblasts.
Hypermethylation of Genes in New Long Noncoding RNA in Ovarian Tumors and Metastases: A Dual Effect.
A ubiquitin-like protein encoded by the ""noncoding"" RNA TINCR promotes keratinocyte proliferation and wound healing.

Long non-coding RNA terminal differentiation-induced non-coding RNA regulates cisplatin resistance of choroidal melanoma by positively modulating extracellular signal-regulated kinase 2 via sponging microRNA-19b-3p.
Expression of SOX2OT, DANCR and TINCR long noncoding RNAs in papillary thyroid cancer and its effects on clinicopathological features.
The lncRNA Tincr Regulates the Abnormal Differentiation of Intestinal Epithelial Stem Cells in the Diabetic State Via the miR-668-3p/Klf3 Axis.
Genetic predisposition to papillary thyroid carcinoma is mediated by a long non-coding RNA TINCR enhancer polymorphism.
IncRNA PLAC2 Upregulates CDK6 by Directly Targeting miR-29C to Promote Cell Proliferation in Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
pTINCR microprotein promotes epithelial differentiation and suppresses tumor growth through CDC42 SUMOylation and activation.
The long noncoding RNA TINCR promotes self-renewal of human liver cancer stem cells through autophagy activation.
LncRNA TINCR impairs the efficacy of immunotherapy against breast cancer by recruiting DNMT1 and downregulating MiR-199a-5p via the STAT1-TINCR-USP20-PD-L1 axis.
The potential roles of lncRNA TINCR in triple negative breast cancer.

Long non-coding RNA TINCR suppresses growth and epithelial-mesenchymal transition by inhibiting Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway in human pancreatic cancer PANC-1 cells: Insights from in vitro and in vivo studies.

name: TINCR ubiquitin domain containing
summary: This gene produces a spliced long non-coding RNA that binds RNAs. This transcript interacts with staufen-1 protein to regulate the stability of mRNAs for genes involved in the differentiation of epidermal tissue. Variation in this gene may be associated with cancer progression. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2017].
